trans-unit.source: "Accessible Books" are books that work well for people with impaired vision. With the ePUB format*, it is possible to make "Born Accessible" books that work well for everyone**, regardless of vision. Bloom has the following tools to help you create these books:
trans-unit.target: "Accessible Books" are books that work well for people with impaired vision. With the ePUB format*, it is possible to make "Born Accessible" books that work well for everyone**, regardless of vision. Bloom has the following tools to help you create these books:

trans-unit.source: This tool, the Accessibility Checker, has:
trans-unit.target: This tool, the Accessibility Checker, has:

trans-unit.source: The "Accessibility Checklist" which is where Bloom checks over your book and points you to anything that needs attention, especially for speakers of minority languages.
trans-unit.target: The "Accessibility Checklist" which is where Bloom checks over your book and points you to anything that needs attention, especially for speakers of minority languages.

trans-unit.source: The "Ace by DAISY Checker" searches the actual ePUB generated by Bloom looking for any problems.
trans-unit.target: The "Ace by DAISY Checker" searches the actual ePUB generated by Bloom looking for any problems.

trans-unit.source: While the ideal is that a single book can serve everyone, the ePUB standard and ePUB readers do not actually support that. They currently only work for blind people who speak a language that is supported by "Text to Speech" (TTS) systems. At this time, TTS is only available for large or commercially interesting languages. Until the standard and accessible readers improve, it is necessary to make special versions of accessible books for minority language speakers. For blind readers to hear the image descriptions, we need to put something special on the page. In this version of Bloom, you do this by clicking the "Include image descriptions on page" checkbox in the Publish:ePUB screen. Future versions may have other options in this area.
trans-unit.target: While the ideal is that a single book can serve everyone, the ePUB standard and ePUB readers do not actually support that. They currently only work for blind people who speak a language that is supported by "Text to Speech" (TTS) systems. At this time, TTS is only available for large or commercially interesting languages. Until the standard and accessible readers improve, it is necessary to make special versions of accessible books for minority language speakers. For blind readers to hear the image descriptions, we need to put something special on the page. In this version of Bloom, you do this by clicking the "Include image descriptions on page" checkbox in the Publish:ePUB screen. Future versions may have other options in this area.

This is identical to Common.Cancel. The duplication was introduced by a mistake.
This is shown at the bottom of a dialog box. It is paired with an action button like "OK" and it means "do not do the action".

If you include "&" (which represents an ampersand) in your translation, it will not be visible in Bloom. Instead, the letter following it will be a keyboard shortcut (e.g., &Cancel means that alt-C can be used to activate the Cancel button.) The letter marked with ampersand is usually the first one but does not have to be. It is important not to mark the same letter in two different controls in the same dialog. If you are not sure, just don't include the "amp;"; the only consequence is that this control cannot be activated using an alt-key shortcut.
This is shown at the bottom of a dialog box and means to go ahead with some action. It is often paired with "Cancel"

trans-unit.source:
The file youâ€™ve chosen is a â€œJPEGâ€ file. JPEG files are perfect for photographs and color artwork. However, JPEG files are a big problem for black and white line art. Problems include:
â€¢ Fuzziness and grey dots.
â€¢ Large file sizes, making the book hard to share.
â€¢ If there are many large JPEGs, Bloom may not have enough memory to make PDF files.

Note: Because JPEG is â€œlossyâ€, converting a JPEG to PNG, TIFF, or BMP actually makes things even worse. If this is black and white line art, you want to get an original scan in one of those formats.

Please select from one of the following, then click â€œOKâ€:
trans-unit.target:
Berkas yang telah Anda pilih adalah berkas â€œJPEGâ€.Berkas JPEG cocok untuk foto dan seni gambar berwarna. Namun berkas JPEG memiliki masalah untuk gambar hitam dan putih. Masalah mencakup:
 â€¢ Gambar kabur dan titik-titik kelabu.
 â€¢ Ukuran berkas besar, sehingga buku sulit dibagikan.
 â€¢ Jika Ada banyak JPEG berukuran besar, Bloom mungkin tidak memiliki cukup memori untuk membuat berkas PDF.

 Perhatikan: Karena sifat JPEG yang â€œbanyak yang terbuangâ€, mengonversikan JPEG ke PNG, TIFF, atau BMP malahan akan membuatnya lebih buruk. Jika ini adalah gambar hitam putih, Anda ingin mendapatkan pindaian asli dalam salah satu format tersebut.

 Pilih dari salah satu yang berikut, lalu klik â€œOkeâ€:

trans-unit.source: Bloom cannot start properly, and this symptom has been observed on machines with ZoneAlarm installed. Note: disabling ZoneAlarm does not help. Nor does restarting with it turned off. Something about the installation of ZoneAlarm causes the problem, and so far only uninstalling ZoneAlarm has been shown to fix the problem.
trans-unit.target: Bloom tidak bisa memulai dengan benar, dan gejala ini terpantau pada mesin yang memasang ZoneAlarm. Catatan: menonaktifkan ZoneAlarm tidak akan membantu. Juga memulainya kembali dengan status dimatikan. Ada sesuatu pada pemasangan ZoneAlarm yang menyebabkan masalah, dan sejauh ini hanya dengan menghapus ZoneAlarm yang tampaknya bisa menyelesaikan masalah ini.
